metadata.title: CVE-2017-11473 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the mp_override_legacy_irq() function inarch/x86/kernel/acpi/boot.c in the Linux kernel through 3.2 allows localusers to gain privileges via a crafted ACPI table.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11473` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-93-generic - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-lowlatency - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-93-generic - 4.4.0-93.116
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1071-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1071.79
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1028-gke - 4.4.0-1028.28

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-93.116').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
